programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Jura The Franche-Comté with its lush green landscapes is also home to innumerable picturesque towns. We visit Baume-les-Messieurs, with its majestic 12th century Romanesque abbey church; Dole on the River Doubs, capital of the arrondissement of the same name; the Château de Joux, a magnificent military ensemble from the Middle Ages. Directed by: Magali Nguyen (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Pyrenees National Park, a commitment as large as nature itself We head for the Béarn, to discover the Pyrenees National Park and those who call it home. Created in 1967, it stretches for 100 kilometres along the mountain ridge that forms the border with Spain, covering two departments and six valleys. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Le goût des rencontres normandes
programme.desc:
Trout with almonds in Saint-Wandrille-Rançon
David Gallienne has a rendezvous at the Le Fontenelle fish farm in Saint-Wandrille-Rançon, Seine-Maritime. In charge is Adélie, who invites him to discover this age-old site where she raises thousands of fish. On the menu: trout cooked with almonds.
Presented by: David Gallienne.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a modern hermit Julien stops off with Guy Boudreau who lives alone in the heart of the boreal forest of North Shore. Experienced mountain guide and adventurer, Guy spent fifteen years building his remote camp, far off the beaten track and the nearest road. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Les tortillas, une offre de plus en plus diversifiée
programme.desc:
Tortillas, an ever-wider range
An essential basic in Mexican cuisine, the humble corn tortilla is constantly evolving to offer ever more variety. Also on the programme: chef François-Xavier Bleau offers his handy hints for successful cooking over a wood fire, the science behind flavours and a close look at the iceberg lettuce.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Quercy One of France's former provinces, barely an hour from Toulouse, Quercy concentrates all the charm of the South-West. A voyage of discovery that explores the department of the Lot, beginning in Rocamadour, a fascinating mediaeval town, that literally clings to the cliff that has protected it since the Middle Ages. Directed by: Éric Maillebiau (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Corrèze, the mountains of the Limousin We set our heading for the Corrèze, amidst the mountains of the Limousin region, and a hike to the Deiro waterfalls, a natural beauty spot where two mills bear witness to man's activities on the Millevaches Plateau. Farther south, we discover the exceptional railway heritage of the Rochers Noirs Viaduct. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Present worldwide, Relais & Châteaux promotes the luxury hotel sector. Cooked upside down and eaten in situ: the Tatin pie, a mouthwatering mistake. The jewellery creator Annelise Michelson moves into design.. Wearing a tie. Akho: the brainchild of a designer launching an eco-responsible brand.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: The free life of a vegan nomad Joëlle, a vegan nomad, took the decision to abandon city life for the peace and quiet of the Rockies. Discussing her life with Julien, she sets out all the advantages of living in the great outdoors, surrounded by breathtaking scenery. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Foodstuffs confiscated by Customs
Each year, more than 40,000 foodstuffs are confiscated when going through Customs in Canada. So what exactly are you allowed to bring back, or not? A beer smoothie: a good mix? We also explore the world of sampling, and construction workers' lunchboxes.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Quercy One of France's former provinces, barely an hour from Toulouse, Quercy concentrates all the charm of the South-West. A voyage of discovery that explores the department of the Lot, beginning in Rocamadour, a fascinating mediaeval town, that literally clings to the cliff that has protected it since the Middle Ages. Directed by: Éric Maillebiau (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Corrèze, the mountains of the Limousin We set our heading for the Corrèze, amidst the mountains of the Limousin region, and a hike to the Deiro waterfalls, a natural beauty spot where two mills bear witness to man's activities on the Millevaches Plateau. Farther south, we discover the exceptional railway heritage of the Rochers Noirs Viaduct. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Paname
programme.desc:
Rue du Louvre
Measuring some 700 metres, the Rue du Louvre runs from the Rue de Rivoli to the Sentier district, crossing the 1st and 2nd arrondissements. Three of the street's best-known buildings have been given a complete facelift: the Bourse du Commerce, the Samaritaine and the legendary Poste Centrale.
Presented by: Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken lasagne
Classic lasagne with a new twist for this chicken lasagne recipe with cauliflower purée and creamy cheese sauce.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Yvonnick Jegat, defending natural oysters
In his "garden" in the Gulf of Morbihan, Yvonnick Jegat cultivates the art of the natural oyster. He uses only sea-born baby oysters, known as spat, that are then raised on the sandy seabed. Maison Jegat, founded in 1925, is a pioneer in the defence of traditional oyster farming.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Que cache le bas prix des bananes ?
programme.desc:
What hides behind the price of bananas?
The banana is one of the most frequently-eaten fruits and one of the cheapest. How are prices kept so low? And should it be cause for celebration? Also on the programme: testing non-stick pans, a spirit made from whey and manioc in every shape and form.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Rigoletto Three acts and four scenes for "Rigoletto", by Giuseppe Verdi, based on a play by Victor Hugo "Le Roi S'Amuse", created at the Teatro La Fenice in 1851. With extracts from Claus Guth's 2016 production at the Opéra de Paris. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Corsica Set in Haute-Corse, Balagne, also known as "the garden of Corsica", is home to innumerable treasures such as the picturesque little port of Saint-Florent, and Pigna, an eagle's nest of steep streets suspended between sea and sky. The citadel of Calvi offers age-old fortifications and one of history's greatest enigmas. Directed by: Hélène Mourot-Braudel (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Corrèze, the mountains of the Limousin We set our heading for the Corrèze, amidst the mountains of the Limousin region, and a hike to the Deiro waterfalls, a natural beauty spot where two mills bear witness to man's activities on the Millevaches Plateau. Farther south, we discover the exceptional railway heritage of the Rochers Noirs Viaduct. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: We head to the Army Museum for a strictly "defensive" visit. Furniture, rugs, objects: Alexia Leleu brings her family history to life. Balenciaga breaks all the rules, freeing fashion from its inhibitions. A journey through time with Les Vertugadins, a design studio creating period costumes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Soupe au maïs et au jalapeno et pain au maïs
programme.desc: Sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and corn bread Sweetcorn forms the base for Kimberly Lallouz' recipes as she prepares a sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and a corn bread roll. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Amélie and Frédéric, Upper Laurentians Amélie, Frédéric and their two daughters felt they were suffocating in their home in Montréal. They moved to live on the banks of a river in the Upper Laurentians. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Les tortillas, une offre de plus en plus diversifiée
programme.desc:
Tortillas, an ever-wider range
An essential basic in Mexican cuisine, the humble corn tortilla is constantly evolving to offer ever more variety. Also on the programme: chef François-Xavier Bleau offers his handy hints for successful cooking over a wood fire, the science behind flavours and a close look at the iceberg lettuce.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: La Courtauld Gallery, Londres La Courtauld Gallery est un musée d'art situé dans le Somerset House, sur le Strand, dans le centre de Londres. Grand collectionneur, visionnaire audacieux, l'industriel Samuel Courtauld a su choisir et promouvoir des artistes, jusque-là refusés par les grandes institutions, dont certains peintres impressionnistes, fauvistes ou cubistes. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Corsica Set in Haute-Corse, Balagne, also known as "the garden of Corsica", is home to innumerable treasures such as the picturesque little port of Saint-Florent, and Pigna, an eagle's nest of steep streets suspended between sea and sky. The citadel of Calvi offers age-old fortifications and one of history's greatest enigmas. Directed by: Hélène Mourot-Braudel (season 1, France, 2014)

Farther south, we discover the exceptional railway heritage of the Rochers Noirs Viaduct. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
It's the season of babies! Louis' telephone hardly stops ringing... everyone thinks they have raccoons or squirrels in their walls or roof.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Quebec flavour for far away recipes The chefs Victor Soto, from the restaurant Tacos Victor, and Paul Toussaint, from the restaurant Kamùy, give recipes from other countries a distinctly Quebec twist. Fabien Cloutier and Johanne Despins have the pleasure of tasting these new culinary creations. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Haut-Rhin Welcome to Alsace, a land of tradition endowed with a heritage of incredible beauty! In the Haut-Rhin, we visit the mediaeval town of Riquewihr, whose wine is exported throughout the world, and Éguisheim, a veritable picture postcard village. Finally, we take a stroll through Colmar, the "little Venice" of Alsace. Directed by: Nicolas Coutand (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Corrèze, the mountains of the Limousin We set our heading for the Corrèze, amidst the mountains of the Limousin region, and a hike to the Deiro waterfalls, a natural beauty spot where two mills bear witness to man's activities on the Millevaches Plateau. Farther south, we discover the exceptional railway heritage of the Rochers Noirs Viaduct. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Hydration and dehydration
How can you tell if you are drinking enough? Also on the programme: Les Herbes Salées du Bas-Saint-Laurent; haggis, the famous dish from Scotland; and black garlic from L'Île d'Orléans...
Presented by: Johane Despins.
